articles.title: OUT OF CONTROL
articles.summary: In early February, the federal Pest Management Regulatory Agency (PMRA) rejected an emergency use application submitted by the Alberta and Saskatchewan governments to make strychnine available for use against gophers.

articles.title: Feedgrain Focus: Markets lift despite patchy rain in south
articles.summary: Wheat and barley prices have strengthened on limited offerings from growers and the trade, and sorghum has kicked in the midst of the Lunar New Year holiday.

articles.title: Ridley HY26 profits up 137pc, fertilisers business update
articles.summary: Stockfeed manufacturer and fertiliser distributor Ridley has reported a statutory net profit after tax of $52.7M, up 137.4pc on the pcp, for 1H26.

articles.title: Low-rainfall cropping country lists in WA, Mallee
articles.summary: WA's North Bullfinch Aggregation and Galick Ridge in the Victorian Mallee are on the market, offering opportunities to buy into low-rainfall cropping country.

articles.summary: A dairy-farming joint venture has paid close to $35M for Logan, an irrigated and dryland property in Tasmania’s tightly held Northern Midlands.

articles.summary: CSIRO has launched FarmPrint to help producers evaluate, benchmark and report on greenhouse gas emissions.

articles.title: New John Deere 8R series up to 634 hp, prepared for ‘Supervised Autonomy’
